The opinion column written by the head o: Rose Mary Grant, framed the debate around the academic growth of students enrolled in Rhode Island's charter schools.
Grant claimed that Rhode Island: s charter schools are nationally recognized as outperforming their counterparts across the country.
Grant clarified that by: outperforming," she meant that charter schools in Rhode Island had more impact on their students than charter schools in other states, as measured by a 2013 study.
The 2013 study: conducted by the Center for Research on Education Outcomes at Stanford University, found that Rhode Island charter school students showed greater learning gains in both reading and math compared to their peers in traditional Rhode Island schools.
